concise_definition: v. 尖叫, 喊叫, 哭喊

definitions.explanation_en: To emit a loud, sharp, high-pitched sound, typically due to fear, pain, excitement, or anger, often involuntarily or with intense emotion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因恐惧、疼痛、兴奋或愤怒而发出响亮、尖锐、高亢的声音，通常带有强烈情绪，有时是无意识的。
definitions.example_en: She screamed when she saw the spider crawling on her arm.
definitions.example_cn: 当她看到蜘蛛爬到手臂上时，她尖叫了起来。

definitions.explanation_en: To shout or cry out loudly, often to attract attention, express urgency, or convey strong feelings, even without physical fear.
definitions.explanation_cn: 大声喊叫，通常是为了引起注意、表达紧迫感或传达强烈情绪，即使没有实际的恐惧。
definitions.example_en: The coach screamed instructions to the players from the sidelines.
definitions.example_cn: 教练在场边大声向球员们喊着指令。

definitions.explanation_en: To produce a sound resembling a human scream, such as wind, machinery, or animals, often to convey intensity or distress.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指发出类似人类尖叫的声音，如风声、机器声或动物叫声，常用来表现强烈或痛苦的状态。
definitions.example_en: The train screamed through the tunnel at full speed.
definitions.example_cn: 火车以全速呼啸着穿过隧道。

comparison.analysis: “Shouted” (喊叫) 指用很大的声音说话，通常是为了传达信息或命令，情绪强度低于 “screamed”。它更偏向于有意识的、语言性的表达，而 “screamed” 更强调情绪爆发，常伴随非语言性的尖锐音调。
“Yelled” (大叫) 与 “screamed” 接近，但语气更中性，可用于愤怒、兴奋或命令等情境，不一定伴随恐惧或痛苦。“Screamed” 更常与极端情绪（如惊恐、剧痛）相关，音高和尖锐度更高。
“Cried” (哭喊) 通常与流泪、悲伤或情绪脆弱相关，声音可能颤抖或断续，而 “screamed” 更强调声音的强度和穿透力，不一定伴随泪水。“Cried” 更具情感脆弱性，“screamed” 更具爆发性和冲击力。
